description:
Explore Christ Church, a Grade II George Bains art nouveau/gothic style church. Activities for families include a treasure trail, games and crafts and cream teas available.
Sat 14 Sept: Open 10am-3pm. 2pm Lecture on George Bains by Andrew Scott, FREE
Friday 20 Sept: 7-9.30pm Concert with Life and mission choir, FREE

events.name: Drop in: George Bains lecture
events.notes: Andrew Wood will give a lecture on George Bains, architect of non-conformist churches and the significance of features in our church.

events.name: Drop in: Open church and reflective space
events.notes: Church open for visitors to explore and have opportunity to take some time to reflect and pray in a calm space of our beautiful church

events.name: Drop in: Choir concert - Life and Mission Choir
events.notes: The Life and Mission choir is an ecumenical choir formed in 2000 in a move of unity among churches. Drinks available before concert.

factsheet.heading: Speaker on George Bains
paragraphs: Come and discover the detail and delight of an arts and crafts style church where even heating vents are beautiful. The building includes curved pews, copper lights and stained glass windows celebrating the parables of Jesus and Scouts service in WWI and WW2. From a local history viewpoint, we host a blue plaque for Benjamin Waugh who founded the church and the NSPCC.
We will host a speaker on Saturday 14 September to discuss the architecture of George Bains.

name: Christ Church New Southgate and Friern Barnet
